message: Hello Bob, I have a great product that I think you'll love. I'm willing to sell it to you for $110.
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $105. Can you meet me halfway?
I can do a bit better than that, Bob. I can meet you at $108, but that's as low as I'm willing to go.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Can you do $105 again? I'm willing to meet you halfway on the original price.

I understand you're still interested in the product, Bob, but I've already met you at $108 and you didn't take it. I'm willing to compromise, but I need to make a profit. I can do $109, but that's as low as I'm willing to go.
I understand your concerns about making a profit, but I'm still not comfortable with $109. Can you meet me at $107? I'm willing to compromise and make a deal.

I appreciate your persistence, Bob, but I've already made concessions. I'm willing to meet you at $108 again, but that's my final offer. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to explore other options.
I understand you're willing to meet me at $108, but I'm still a bit short on budget. Can you do $106? I'm willing to make a deal, but I need to stay within my budget.
I've already made several concessions, Bob. I'm not willing to go any lower than $108. If you're not willing to meet me there, I'll have to explore other options.
I understand you're not willing to go any lower, but I'm still not comfortable with $108. I'm willing to walk away if we can't meet in the middle. Can you do $107? It's my final offer.
